intro: Boechera crandallii, commonly known as the Crandall's rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in mountainous regions. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces small, round seeds. Boechera crandallii is noted for its ability to thrive in harsh, arid environments.
